name: Hotel Banys Orientals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Banys Oriental is first of all in an absolutely perfect spot of Barcelona. Ive been to Barcelona before and this area is really where to stay. It is very good value for the money - clean, lovely architecture and very stylish decorated - Very nice bathroom and very comfortable beds. Complimentary waters and apples added to the great stay.
reviews.title: all you want and need in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What you see on ther wep page is really what you get. Some has written that the rooms are a bit small - I don't know what they compare to, being in the middle of an european city and being a 3 star hotel I found the room normal size, not small at all.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff, Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've heard it can be noice from the street - I am not surprised, there are lots of businesses and restaurants on the street. We requested a quiet room and had the best sleep in a long time. We didnt have a balcony but that was fine for us. Breakfast is more than great. Here as well you really get your money worth. We only had breakfast once though - there are som many cafés and restaurnants in the neighbourhood that need to be discoverd. = ) Only bad thing is that the breakfast room was a bit dark. We paid around 100 euro a night and I consider that a very resonable price for this lovely hotel. I will be back = )
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but..............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Have just returned from a 2 night break in Barcelona. We stayed at the Hotel Banys Orientals and loved it. The rooms were very clean, minimalistic and the shower powerful and refreshing. After reading other comments about noise etc. I emailed the hotel and asked for a room on the top floor away from any obvious sources of noise. I was not disappointed. The walls are not the thickest but apart from the occasional sound of conversation next door we were not troubled. The beds were comfortable and we slept really well. We did have long, busy days though.
reviews.title: Great location - noisy rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to take breakfast in the hotel and there was always plenty of choice with staff refilling empty dishes efficiently. We were set for the day after eating. The staff at reception were very friendly with welcoming 'Holas' every time we passed through reception. They quickly answered our questions and phoned several of the churches to supply us with a very comprehensive list of mass times. They also gave us some good shopping tips.
reviews.title: avoid except for location and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can get a room at this place, book it! It is a great hotel that is simple, elegant, in a fabulous location, and is gorgeous. We had a cute little balcony that looked down and allyway and just thoroughly enjoyed our room and the area around it. It is one of the best kept secrets out there (at least when we were there, and I found it in a travel and leisure article). It is EXTREMELY affordable and easily competes with the most expensive hotels in barcelona. I would strongly encourage you to check it out, as it is close to las ramblas, gothic quarter, the gay district, and the beach. Check it out! There is also a great tapas restaurant right in front of the hotel you should try (I think it is a chain). Go HERE!
reviews.title: One of the best hotels we've ever stayed at

likes.disliked: — I did not find any weaknesses!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had checked various websites including "tripadvisor" before booking this hotel for a long weekend with my wife and another couple. However closer to our departure I got a bit nervous as some of the reviews were not favourable but I decided to stick with our original (and very cheap) booking. I need not have worried. The location (in El Born) is fantastic with so many shops, restaurants and cafes nearby in little sidestreets and squares. The hotel reception is little more than a desk and anyone who wants a grand lobby, bar or even a great buzz from the hotel will be disappointed. However all of these things are provided by the area in spades so the lack of facilities were made up by the rooms. We had booked suites which were a few hundred yards away off the Placa Santa Maria which again had plenty of life both day and night. The rooms were very spacious and well-kept. The decor was modern and minimal without being sparse. They are like small apartments with a shared communal entrance but at @ £90 per night they were a bargain. I would have no hesutation staying there again and although some reviews said staff could be surly they booked a restaurant and taxis for us with no difficulty and were very courteous. If you spend a lot of time around your hotel go somewhere else but if you enjoy a little bit of luxury at a knockdown price book it now.
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: surly staff, smelly room, noisy, and conned us with the exchange rate and wouldn't respond to my requests for an explanation. Don't go.
reviews.title: rip-off banys

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a nice and modern hotel. We stayed for four nights. We stayed in the suites which is in a separate building about 5 minutes away from the main location. It gives you a feeling of having your own apartment in Barcelona. Our suite was huge and very classy, cool, and modern. It's surrounded by tine old streets and so you can hear whatever goes on. We stayed on the first floor. This is the metalsmithing area so you can hear some of that. Also, when people talk in the streets, you may be able to hear it. The room was beautiful and airy. TV only had Spanish local channels. Bathroom had a huge shower, but some of the fixtures were coming out of the wall (soap dish).
reviews.title: Nice for the money, but a little noisy!

likes.liked: — Large room and very fair price for suite.
likes.disliked: — Limited TV, bathroom had some minor problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Banys for 3 nights and were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms were not terribly huge, but big enough, and furnished very nicely. Cool, stylish design, a nice view from our 2nd story window to the pedestrian alley below with the Christmas market. Located very close to the old quarter of Barcelona, the hotel is walking distance from so many attractions - we walked down to the harbor, into the old city, all over the place!
reviews.title: cool style

likes.liked: — cool desiign, stylish interior, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An awesome find! Our friends stayed here in 2005 and recommended the hotel to us for our trip - we couldn't have been happier. The rooms were clean and full of nice touches (I loved the bath slippers!) and the hotel provided free water (with or without gas) in the upstairs hall as well as free internet at two computers. It was so nice to be able to quickly research sites around the city or keep in touch with home. We didn't try the hotel restaurant but every night there were lines out the door of folks waiting to be seated. Also, the location is great - close to the Musee Picasso and steps away from the metro. Las Ramblas is within walking distance as is the Cathedral and Placa Reial....and, the only reason I'm not giving this a 5-rating is because some of the rooms are right on the street and it can get a bit noisy at night - it bothered my husband but didn't affect me at all. If that worries you then just ask for a room in the back!
reviews.title: Perfect!

likes.liked: — Free Internet, Free Water, Great Location, Clost to Great Restaurants
likes.disliked: — Could be noisy at night in the street-side rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Other best bets in Barcelona:
reviews.title: Smack dab in the Middle of Everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We ate at the tapas restaurant a couple of doors down for lunch, Taller de Tapas (tallerdetapas.com/), which was great! The tapas were reasonably priced and all were delicious.
reviews.title: For the money...this is a great little hotel

likes.liked: — Reasonably priced, centrally located, good design elements
likes.disliked: — The lack of ventilation in the bathroom...smelled mildewy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight for dinner was Les Quinze Nits (lesquinzenits.com/) within walking distance at Placa Reial. Get there at 8 or before to wait in line, and don't be stressed if you get there and the line is really long. The restaurant opens at 8:30 so everyone is seated in order and the restaurant is much bigger than it appears so pretty much every one was seated without a problem. The meals are so reasonably priced it is almost unbelieveable - between the terrace seating and delicious food this might be the best deal in the city.
reviews.title: This Should Have Been So Much Beter...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I found Bany's to be a contemporary hotel in a great area. Close to Las Ramblas, the Picasso museum and several very interesting Barcelona icons. It may not be the place for travelers who like a lot of peace and quite but if you're looking to enjoy the city and be in walking distance of most things, then it's the place for you!
reviews.title: Fantasticly priced boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The man at the front desk every night has very poor comprehension of English and has the nerve to yell at guests for it! Usually I don't think service is critical, but you will when you need it.
reviews.title: Reception doesn't understand English

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We arrived late and asked what restaurants were still open, but of course, the night receptionist didn't speak English.
reviews.title: Well worth it!

likes.liked: — Nice design in a central locattion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then on a cold night, we couldn't turn off the a/c, but the guy didn't understand and started raising his voice at me. After I explained in rudimentary Spanish, he muttered "Dios!" and hung up.
reviews.title: Nice but loud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A hotel with international clientele should have staff that speaks English, the most commonly spoken language around the world. No wonder this place is only 2 star.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the suites are in a building without an elevator. Not fun to hike up 6 stories every day to your room.
reviews.title: Super Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Although I found this hotel as recommended by Conde Nast Travaler magazine in 2006, I would strongly advise not to stay there. I guess a lot has changed since 2006. Upon our arrival we were treated with great disprespect by the reception staff, they were trying to make us pay for one extra bed although the previous arrangments were made months before. Upon my notice that we had already agreed upon everything before, Mr. Juan Pablo at the reception explained that he has arrived at 3:00 PM that day and he does not care about my arranagments. In the meantime Mrs. Emelie from the reception was just smiling at our conversation and considered everything to be a good joke. There was no one on the duty responsible that evening, so we could not really speak to anybody else. The manager's name was declined to us. The best part happened when we tried to check out - there was an attempt to charge us double price presuming we had not paid1/2 for the hotel before. Again we needed to enter into discussions and prove our point. So, my advise is to avoid this hotel if you want a stay without arguing to the staff. Also about safety - the rooms can be accessed throught the balconies from the street. The sign on the balcony's door says - please close when out of room and while sleeping for your own safety. One day when we came back to the room after being away for the whole day, the balcony's door was wide open since the cleaner had opened it and forgotten to close it.
reviews.title: Terrible service and staff atitude - there are many better hotels in Barcelona!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our recent honeymoon to Spain, Barcelona was our first stop. We wanted a reasonably priced, well situated, safe place to stay to help us discover all the city's charms, and Hotel Banys Orientals could not have been a better choice!
reviews.title: A perfect boutique hotel in a great neighborhood!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location is great. There are hip shops and restaurants right outside the door, but the side street on which the Hotel is located does not create a lot of street noise. You are incredibly close to a Metro Stop and also within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas and many other attractions including a short walk to the beach! One of our favorite things to do was to walk outside and get lost in the charming streets of the Gothic neigborhood. Unlike the more hectic sections of the city, we never felt unsafe in the immediate vicinity of the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent location - fine hotel - very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations and any questions that we had. The fridge full of free water (both with and without gas) and the free internet were also nice bonuses!
reviews.title: Perfect. Finally value for money in a city!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although on the smaller side, our corner room was not as small as some of the rooms we had seen in Spain and it also allowed us privacy. It was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Perfect Location - Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is a 3-star hotel that is just beautiful and located close to everything! I would definitely stay here again, and definitely recommend to others. I'm glad I booked in advance because once I arrived and checked-in, I found that they were completely booked.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong staying here if you want to be centrally located in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was traveling solo, and booked a single room for the first two nights. The single room was small (the bathroom was almost as large as the sleeping area!). My third night I transferred to a double room which was really much more spacious, but of course a bit more expensive.
reviews.title: Location great, the suite unsuitable dark/musty bathroom mouldy not nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is internet and A/C in the room, it's very comfortable, and very quiet. There is also a restaurant on-site, but I did not try it. The location cannot be beat... it is right smack in the middle of everthing in the central part of downtown, maybe a 10-15 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya, 10 minutes to Las Ramblas, and a minute or two to all the wonderful tapas bars.
reviews.title: Great location & nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff here is absolutely fantastic. I can't think of anything negative about this place - except it would be nice if the price were a bit lower but hey, this is Barcelona so you're going to pay a bit more.
reviews.title: Spacious suite with perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Suite they put us in is away from the Hotel itself, has no lift and the stairs are not suitable for seniors, myself, husband & mature daughter had two flights of steps, my older brother in law and his wife had 4 flights of steps to conquer, a challenge you might say, a virtual nightmare i would say as it has not much lighting and the suites although quite large were dark inside and the bathrooms were extremely dark/musty and mouldy. We were extremely disappointed as when we made a complaint to change rooms no feed back was given, we then requested to view the rooms in the real part of the hotel, they had at least a lift and the room shown is the one on the internet site not the ones we were put in. The location is very good though and near the barri gotic the port and not far from La Rambla no complaints re the location. If booking this hotel please request the rooms where the lift is located or if you can find another Hotel book that one.
reviews.title: Hotel Banys Oriental

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel - very nice design
reviews.title: Tired, run down, bad service but good for price and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms - nice design and very well equipped. Free bottled water and WIFI. However, way to small and really tired, The bathroom was mouldy and the shower was broken, Flooring coming up.
reviews.title: Gem of a hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service - awful. Everything too much trouble. I was even refused the loan of a pen.
reviews.title: Small but perfectly formed..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location - fantastic. In the middle of everything.
reviews.title: Great location, very nice room and fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Value - despite the above problems, the hotel is good value at 99 euro
reviews.title: Bugs Banys - Beware!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I and my daughter (14) have just returned home to Toronto after 4 nights at the Banys Orientals. We'd read the reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to stay in a suite for the extra space and to avoid the street noise. We paid 129 Euros a night with no additional taxes.
reviews.title: Definitely going back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main hotel and reception are located on a pedestrian street so the the taxi driver was unable to drive us to the door of the hotel. He hustled us and our extensive luggage out of the car at the top of the street. In the end it was only a 1-minute walk to the hotel but it was disconcerting at the time.
reviews.title: simplistic loveliness, perfect honeymoon retreat

likes.disliked: — the not so well lit street the suites are located on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The reception staff are friendly, efficient and English speaking. It is a 3 to 5 minute walk to the suites which are also located on a residential street. The location is excellent for 3 reasons. First we loved feeling part of local life - our suite had 3 of those skinny balconies where we could look out onto street life and into the apartments opposite. Second it only took us a minute to reach the square at the front of the imposing Santa Maria church where we could enjoy a perfect breakfast of fresh squeezed oj, croissants and cafe con leche at the oh-so-hip Bubo bar, or a great tapas dinner at Taller de Tapas ; or the very best gelati at Artisan (?). Third we could walk to many places including La Rambla for shopping or to Barceloneta to eat on the seafront.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building in which the suites are located is a total and modern reno. Our suite was very stylish, spacious and immacuately clean. When the doors to the balcony were closed, I don't recall hearing any noise at all. The mini fridge was restocked daily with multiple bottles of water (with and without gas).
reviews.title: Best value in town! This place is a gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only drawback was the phone service - friends found it very difficult to get through to our suite and, if they did, they could barely hear our voices. Oh yes, and like many hotels these days, it had one of those annoying hairdryers where you have to keep holding down the ON button the whole time you dry your hair.
reviews.title: Great location and price!

description: In El Born district in Barcelona, symbol of the city´s history, surrounds this familiar, modern and cozy hotel constructed in an antique building.The hotel is located in an absolutey remarkable position, on a pedestrian street in the very centre of Barcelona old town. Ramblas are only 500 metres away from our hotel that also lies right half-way through the stunning Barcelona Cathedral and the historical Santa Maria del Mar church.Surrounded by our city´s history in one of the most modern district, our guest will enjoy not only their accomodation but also the infinite relax and entertainment possibilities Barcelona offers
